meanings.definition: An assembly of wise men or counselors in Anglo-Saxon England.
meanings.sent1: The witans gathered to discuss important matters in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The witans made decisions that shaped the future of the land.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, the witans shared stories to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: Their unity in the witan was like a beacon of wisdom in troubled times.
meanings.sent5: The witans' advice was sought by all in times of need.

meanings.definition: The members of such an assembly.
meanings.sent1: The witans were respected individuals chosen for their knowledge.
meanings.sent2: Each of the witans had a unique perspective to contribute.
meanings.sent3: One witan always brought delicious snacks to the meetings.
meanings.sent4: Among the witans, there was a sense of camaraderie and mutual respect.
meanings.sent5: The witans' influence extended far beyond the walls of the assembly.
